titleStmt.title: A vision or dreame contayning the whole state of the Netherland warres as it appeared to a louer of the Netherlands lying in his bed, vpon the 7. of Nouember, betweene 3. and 4. of the clocke in the morning, wherein was represented vnto him a goodly country, and therein a fayre comely horse well brideled and sadled, whereat being much amazed, he sayde, behold the horse, but where is the rider? ...

A vision or dreame contayning the whole state of the Netherland warres as it appeared to a louer of the Netherlands lying in his bed, vpon the 7. of Nouember, betweene 3. and 4. of the clocke in the morning, wherein was represented vnto him a goodly country, and therein a fayre comely horse well brideled and sadled, whereat being much amazed, he sayde, behold the horse, but where is the rider? ...

publicationStmt.publisher: [By G. Purslowe and N. Okes] for Edward Marchant,

notesStmt.note: Printers' names from STC; Purslowe printed quires A-D, and Okes printed the rest.
Text in English and Dutch, the latter with caption title reading: Een visioen in den droom.

Includes: Looke out good countrimen while you haue time and tide, behold a strange dance made about the Holland bride, with caption title; text in Dutch as well, with caption title reading: Ghy patriotten kijck uut, kijck uut, siet wat een vreemden dans, om de Hollandtsche bruut.
In two parts; part 2 has separate dated title page reading: A short and faithfull narration from certaine citizens of note of the towne of Goch .. .
Includes the Dutch edition of part 2, with separate dated title page reading: Cort en waeractich verhael wt de mont van eenighe loffweerdige borgers van holGoch, .. .
Part 2 formerly STC 11925; identified by that number on UMI microfilm, reel 578 (part 2 only).
Imperfect: part 2 lacking. Bound with STC 18437.5: Newes of the netherlands.
Reproductions of the originals in the British Library, the Folger Shakespeare Library, and the Bodleian Library.

Appears at reel 578 (Folger Shakespeare Library copy, part 2 only), at reel 1075 #6 (British Library copy, part 1 only), and at reel 2012 (Bodleian Library, title page to first part and text of second part only).
